formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are gathered from the given configuration.

formElement.label: Wsadmin Absolute Path:
formElement.documentation: Absolute path of wsadmin, including filename and extension. Optional if the location of wsadmin is in the PATH environment variable. E.g., '/path/to/wsadmin.sh' or 'wsadmin.bat'.

formElement.label: Scope:
formElement.documentation: Specifies a scope of cell, node, server, or cluster for the JMS provider. E.g. Cell=Cell01,Node=Node01,Server=server1

formElement.label: JMS Provider Name:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the name to assign to the new JMS provider.

formElement.label: Initial Context Factory:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the Java class name of the initial context factory for the JMS provider.

formElement.label: JMS provider URL:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the JMS provider URL for external JNDI lookups.

formElement.label: Classpath:
formElement.documentation: Specifies a list of paths or Java archive (JAR) file names which together form the location for the resource provider classes. Use a semicolon (;) to separate class paths.

formElement.label: Description:
formElement.documentation: Specifies a description of the JMS Provider.

formElement.label: Isolated Class Loader:
formElement.documentation: If set to true, specifies that the resource provider is loaded in its own class loader.

formElement.label: Native Path:
formElement.documentation: Specifies an optional path to any native libraries, such as *.dll and *.so. Native path entries are separated by a semicolon (;).

formElement.label: Provider Type:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the JMS provider type that this JMS provider uses.

formElement.label: Property Set:
formElement.documentation: Specifies resource properties in the following format: [[['name','nameValue1'],['type','typeValue1'],['value','valueValue1']]... [['name','nameValuen'],['type','typeValuen'],['value','valueValuen']]]

formElement.label: Supports ASF:
formElement.documentation: If set to true, specifies that the JMS provider supports Application Server Facilities (ASF), which provides concurrency and transactional support for applications.

formElement.label: Connection Type:
formElement.documentation: Specifies to type of connection to use to connect to the application server that you want to administer. The valid choices are SOAP, RMI, and NONE. Default is SOAP.
